item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (1131 points | 1143 comments)
2. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (682 points | 749 comments)
3. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1243 points | 389 comments)
4. Arm releases Chiplet System Architecture spec beta version (44 points | 12 comments)
5. The testing pyramid is an outdated economic model (27 points | 8 comments)
6. Infinigen (138 points | 11 comments)
7. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (222 points | 102 comments)
8. Moving on from React, a year later (246 points | 150 comments)
9. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (111 points | 29 comments)
10. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (341 points | 172 comments)
11. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (285 points | 79 comments)
12. Icelandic turf houses: Laufas, Glaumbaer and others (23 points | 7 comments)
13. Flame: A small language model for spreadsheet formulas (2023) (35 points | 3 comments)
14. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (74 points | 55 comments)
15. Why is zero plural? (2024) (65 points | 104 comments)
16. Castle Game Engine: Web target – big progress, first 3 demos to try (77 points | 13 comments)
17. The first release of OpenVox, the OSS implementation of Puppet (35 points | 13 comments)
18. Mercator: Extreme (160 points | 36 comments)
19. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (177 points | 17 comments)
20. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (420 points | 198 comments)
21. 2,100-year-old Alexander the Great mosaic analyzed for restoration (4 points | discuss)
22. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (51 points | discuss)
23. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (61 points | 15 comments)
24. Life in Another Light, 2024 Infrared-Photography-Contest Winners (13 points | 3 comments)
25. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (89 points | 23 comments)
26. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (139 points | 76 comments)
27. Sigstore: Making sure your software is what it claims to be (84 points | 26 comments)
28. Concept cells help your brain abstract information and build memories (107 points | 11 comments)
29. Show HN: I made a app that uses NFC as a physical switch to block distractions (188 points | 99 comments)
30. Rafael Araujo's 20 Mesmerizing Geometrical Masterpieces (2024) (108 points | 16 comments)
